episodeTitle: Its Name Is The New World! The Fate Of The Grand Line!
description: After the Enies Lobby victory, Garp visits the Straw Hats and allows Koby and Helmeppo to meet Luffy. Koby reveals information about the New World, the second half of the Grand Line where the next Pirate King will emerge. Meanwhile, Robin has a private encounter with Aokiji who reveals his connection to Jaguar D. Saul and acknowledges that she has finally found true friends.

events.title: Garp Spares Luffy
events.description: Vice Admiral Garp announces he will not capture Luffy despite his pirate activities, citing their family relationship. He tells Luffy he will use this as an excuse when reporting to the Marines.
events.significance: Demonstrates Garp's internal conflict between duty to the Marines and love for his grandson, foreshadowing future family dynamics.

quotes.text: I'll let you go since you're my grandson. I'll use that as an excuse when I tell the Marines.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp explaining why he won't arrest Luffy after Enies Lobby

events.title: Koby and Luffy Reunion
events.description: Garp allows Koby and Helmeppo to visit Luffy. The two friends reunite and reminisce about their first meeting, though the anime incorrectly states they met on Alvida's ship rather than at her base.
events.significance: Shows the growth of both characters since Episode 1 and maintains their friendship despite being on opposing sides.

events.title: The New World Introduced
events.description: Koby explains to Luffy about 'The New World,' the second half of the Grand Line beyond the Red Line. He reveals that this is where pirates compete to become King of the Pirates, and only Gol D. Roger has reached its end.
events.significance: Critical world-building moment that introduces the concept of the New World, establishing the next major phase of the story and Luffy's journey.

quotes.text: The back half of the Grand Line is known as 'The New World.' It's where the next Pirate King will be crowned.
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby explaining the New World to Luffy while Nami secretly listens

events.title: Calm Belt and Seastone Technology Revealed
events.description: Koby reveals classified Navy intelligence about the Calm Belt, a sea filled with Sea Kings, and how Navy warships can traverse it using Seastone technology that makes ships undetectable to Sea Kings by mimicking the properties of seawater.
events.significance: Explains how the Marines can navigate dangerous waters and introduces important technology that will be relevant to future plot points.

events.title: Dr. Vegapunk First Mentioned
events.description: Dr. Vegapunk is mentioned for the first time in the series. Koby credits him as the genius scientist who understands Devil Fruit power transmission and developed the technology to allow objects to 'eat' Devil Fruits and the Seastone ship technology.
events.significance: First introduction of one of the most important scientists in the One Piece world, whose research and inventions play crucial roles throughout the series.

quotes.text: It's all thanks to Dr. Vegapunk's research on Devil Fruits.
quotes.speaker: Koby

events.title: Koby's Admiral Dream Declaration
events.description: Koby boldly declares his ambition to become an Admiral in the Navy, acknowledging that this puts him and Luffy on opposing paths as enemies. He challenges Luffy to meet him in the New World as worthy rivals.
events.significance: Establishes Koby's long-term goal and parallels with Luffy's dream, setting up their future rivalry while maintaining their friendship.

quotes.text: My dream is to become an Admiral! Even though we're enemies now, let's meet again in the New World and see whose dream comes true!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby declaring his dream to Luffy

quotes.text: You got it! I challenge you to make that dream come true!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Water 7 Victory Celebration
events.description: A massive celebration party begins at the Galley-La Company pool, featuring the Straw Hat Pirates, Franky Family, Galley-La workers, and local Water 7 residents celebrating their victory over CP9 and survival of the Buster Call.
events.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Enies Lobby arc and shows the bonds formed between the Straw Hats and Water 7 citizens.

events.title: Aokiji Confronts Robin
events.description: Admiral Aokiji appears privately to Robin at the pool party. Robin asks why he didn't stop her when she ran away for 20 years, and she explains she can't run anymore now that she's found true friends.
events.significance: Critical character development for Robin, showing her acceptance of the Straw Hats as her family and her decision to stop running from her past.

quotes.text: Why didn't you run away like you had for 20 years?
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji questioning Robin's change in behavior

quotes.text: I can't run away anymore. Not when I've finally found my friends.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin explaining why she stopped running

events.title: Aokiji Reveals Connection to Jaguar D. Saul
events.description: Aokiji reveals that Jaguar D. Saul, whom he was forced to kill 20 years ago during the Ohara Buster Call, was a close friend of his. He explains this is why he has been keeping tabs on Robin.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Aokiji's actions and his relationship with Robin, explaining his conflicted behavior throughout the series.

quotes.text: Jaguar D. Saul was a close friend of mine. I was forced by duty to kill him that day.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji explaining his connection to Saul

events.title: Aokiji's 20-Year Protection of Robin
events.description: Aokiji reveals he made a promise to Saul to keep Robin safe. For 20 years, he has been secretly watching over Robin from afar, protecting her while she was alone and friendless.
events.significance: Explains Aokiji's actions at Long Ring Long Land and why he allowed Robin to escape, recontextualizing their previous encounters.

quotes.text: Saul asked me one favor before he died - to make sure you were safe. For 20 years, I've kept tabs on you, watching over the homeless, friendless Robin.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji explaining his promise to Saul

events.title: Aokiji Accepts Robin's New Life
events.description: Aokiji acknowledges that Robin has found true friends with the Straw Hats after witnessing their rescue of her at Enies Lobby. He accepts this and tells her she can finally stop running from her past and live with resolve as the last survivor of Ohara.
events.significance: Marks a turning point for Robin's character arc and Aokiji's acceptance that his 20-year vigil is complete. Robin is finally free to live without fear.

quotes.text: With true friends, you can stop running from your past and stand tall as the last survivor of Ohara. Live your life with resolve.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji giving Robin his blessing to move forward

events.title: Nami Overhears Navy Intelligence
events.description: Nami is shown secretly listening to Koby's classified information about the New World, the Calm Belt, and Navy technology while appearing to relax by the pool.
events.significance: Shows Nami's tactical intelligence gathering and establishes that the Straw Hats now have knowledge about the New World and Navy capabilities.

themes.description: The episode explores the parallel dreams of Luffy (becoming Pirate King) and Koby (becoming Admiral), showing how former allies can pursue opposing paths while maintaining mutual respect.
themes.symbolism: The New World represents the ultimate proving ground where both characters' dreams will be tested.

themes.description: Robin's encounter with Aokiji emphasizes her journey from isolation to finding a true family with the Straw Hats. After 20 years of running, she can finally stand still.
themes.symbolism: The celebration party symbolizes Robin's integration into a community that accepts and protects her.

themes.description: Both Garp and Aokiji struggle with their duties as Marines versus their personal relationships - Garp with his grandson Luffy, and Aokiji with his promise to Saul regarding Robin.
themes.symbolism: The Marines represent law and order, but both characters choose to honor personal bonds within the constraints of their positions.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how the past shapes the present through Aokiji's 20-year protection of Robin in honor of Saul, and Robin's role as Ohara's last survivor.
themes.symbolism: Robin carrying Ohara's legacy represents the importance of preserving history and knowledge.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin acknowledges she has found true friends and can finally stop running from her past. Her 20-year journey of isolation ends as she accepts the Straw Hats as her family.

Learns about Aokiji's promise to Saul

characterSpotlights.development: Koby demonstrates his growth from the timid cabin boy in Episode 1 to a confident Marine with grand ambitions. He establishes his dream to become Admiral and his rivalry with Luffy.

Challenges Luffy to meet in the New World
quotes: My dream is to become an Admiral! Even though we're enemies now, let's meet again in the New World and see whose dream comes true!

characterSpotlights.development: Aokiji's character is recontextualized as we learn about his friendship with Saul and his 20-year protection of Robin, showing his more compassionate side beneath his lazy justice.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy learns about the New World and accepts Koby's challenge to meet there, setting his sights on the next phase of his journey.
quotes: You got it! I challenge you to make that dream come true!

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Luffy and Koby's dialogue states they met on Alvida's ship. In the manga and Episode 1, they actually met at Alvida's land base, not on her ship.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first mention of Dr. Vegapunk in the One Piece anime, a character who wouldn't physically appear until over 700 episodes later.
Episode 315 adapts Chapter 433, pages 2-18 of the manga, with Episode 316 adapting only page 19, showing a slower pacing typical of the anime during this period.
This episode had a TV rating of 10.4% when it aired in Japan on June 24, 2007.
Starting from Episode 279, One Piece stopped using ending themes for almost 800 episodes. Episode 315 was part of this period where only opening themes were used.
